content: I understand that you can move the Favourites Folder section within the Folder pane, however I would like to have the Favourites section pinned to the top of the folder pane so that it remains visible as you scroll down the list of folders. The issue is when you scroll down through your folders, the Favourites Folder is no longer visible and you have to use the scroll bar to go up to the top of the Folder Pane to see it again. I would like to be able to click on a Favourite folder while I'm at the bottom of my list of folders so I don't have to scroll. Like freezing the first column and row of a spreadsheet so that no matter where you are in the spreadsheet you can see the column headings and row labels.
creator: cdhiggins

content: In the attached picture, you can see that Favourite Folders are at the bottom of the Folder Pane. Click the ... and select Move Up to place it at the top.

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help

There is a common way to change these values for mac or windows. what is the type of PC that you have?

Text forum :

Go to the menu bar, select Thunderbird > Preferences (Mac) or Tools > Options (Windows PC). Then click display.

Select the default font and size you prefer to change colors, select Colors. When you're happy with your choices, select OK.

Clear the Allow messages to use other fonts check box so that your choices override those of senders.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.



Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

creator: @next

content:
Spectrum/TWC settings are hard to pin down. I think the server should be mail.twc.com, according to Spectrum.

Try these settings: mail.twc.com on port 587, STARTTLS security, normal password, User Name = email address. If that doesn't work, try the same but with SSL/TLS security (choose the security, then type in 587).

In the event that Bitdefender is interfering, I suggest running Windows in safe mode to bypass startup apps ('disabling' BD not sufficient).
creator: sfhowes

content:
Global Inbox is only for POP accounts. For IMAP, or a mix of POP and IMAP, use Unified Folders.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Global_Inbox
creator: sfhowes

content: Try Postbox. It's not updated frequently and has similar layout. It began as a Thunderbird clone, so you should feel right at home. But don't look for a support forum, as there is none.

content:
Il sito support.mozilla.org è solo un'area di discussione a disposizione degli utenti Mozilla; Non è un servizio di supporto tecnico, che del resto sarebbe insostenibile per un programma gratuito.

Per quanto riguarda la tua domanda, se riporti esattamente il messaggio di errore si può provare a cercare una soluzione.
